projects.name: Avédon Collective
projects.subtitle: Luxury streetwear system engineered for product, identity, and launch velocity.
problem: Build a cohesive luxury streetwear platform that could support ongoing capsule launches.
Establish a visual and operational framework that remains consistent across product lines.
approach: Structured the parent architecture and product naming system.
Defined core visual language, typography behavior, and campaign standards.
Mapped launch sequences for seasonal drops and commerce touchpoints.
execution: Visual direction for apparel and campaign assets
outcome: A scalable brand system that supports premium positioning and repeatable launches.
A clearer product hierarchy that accelerates design and release cycles.
metrics: Unified identity across all brand surfaces

projects.name: MT Mug Coffee
projects.subtitle: Borough-rooted coffee brand built for recurring commerce and lifestyle expansion.
problem: Create a credible coffee identity that could convert first-time visitors into returning customers.
Align packaging, web UX, and brand messaging into a single system.
approach: Positioned the brand around borough narrative and ritual-based consumption.
Designed digital customer journeys around clarity, speed, and trust.
Defined metadata and launch sequencing for organic discoverability.
outcome: A tightly integrated brand and commerce stack with improved conversion readiness.
A repeatable visual system for product storytelling and retention campaigns.

projects.name: Staten News
projects.subtitle: Modern editorial platform structured for consistent publishing across sectors.
problem: Launch a media property that balances speed of publication with editorial consistency.
Create modular systems for stories spanning technology, finance, and culture.
approach: Built repeatable editorial frameworks for weekly publishing.
Defined tone, layout standards, and distribution cadence.
Established production workflows to reduce bottlenecks.
outcome: A stable publishing platform with consistent release cadence.
Higher content clarity and brand recognition across weekly editions.

projects.name: Bobby Black NYC
projects.subtitle: Operational order and menu infrastructure for a fast-moving food brand.
problem: Reduce friction across ordering and menu updates without introducing heavy tooling.
Support fast changes in a high-velocity menu environment.
approach: Mapped lightweight order-intake routes and communication loops.
Created a transparent process for menu revisions and deployment.
Prioritized reliability and speed for operators.
outcome: Faster operational cycles and cleaner customer ordering flow.
Lower overhead for ongoing menu and fulfillment changes.

projects.name: Avédon Atelier
projects.subtitle: Upcoming atelier line extending Avédon into bespoke visual and product narratives.
problem: Develop a premium extension that preserves Avédon coherence while introducing a bespoke tier.
